author: wsjcom
title: Letters Connect Loved Ones, Living and Past
text:
I relished reading “Letters My Father Wrote” (Journal Report, April 23) in which Robbie Shell tells about finding boxes of family letters between her father and his parents during World War II and other times past. Our family had similar boxes. Years ago we organized them into well-labeled loose-leaf binders, and what a treasure those letters are.
A first set is from summers in the 1920s, describing family vacations between New Jersey and Maine. A set of 1930s letters are between my Dad and his parents while he was away at...
